units.title: Cell lysis for scRNA-seq
units.text: Cells (106) were pel- leted and lysed for 3 min in 100 μl chilled lysis buffer (10 mM Tris-HCl pH 7.4, 10 mM NaCl, 3 mM MgCl2, 0.1% Tween-20, 0.1% Igepal CA-630, 0.01% digitonin, 1% bovine serum albumin (BSA)).
units.rationale: Lysis creates a single‑cell suspension suitable for downstream scRNA‑seq processing.

units.title: Nucleus isolation from frozen tissue
units.text: Nuclei were iso- lated from frozen tissues as described57. In brief, frozen tissue samples were thawed in 2 ml chilled homogenization buffer (10 mM Tris pH 7.8, 5 mM CaCl2, 3 mM magnesium acetate, 320 mM sucrose, 0.1 mM EDTA, 0.1% NP40, 167 μM β-mercaptoethanol, 16.7 μM PMSF) and lysed in a pre-chilled dounce.
units.rationale: Isolating nuclei enables downstream single‑nucleus ATAC‑seq and other nuclear assays.

units.title: Single-cell RNA-seq library generation (10X)
units.text: Single-cell RNA-seq libraries were generated using the 10X Genomics Chromium 3′ Gene Expression Kit. In brief, single cells were loaded onto chromium chips with a capture target of 10,000 cells per sample.
units.rationale: Encapsulating individual cells in droplets creates barcoded libraries for transcriptome profiling.

units.title: Bulk ATAC-seq library preparation
units.text: Bulk ATAC-seq libraries were generated as described57. In brief, 50,000 nuclei were permeablized and tagmented. Tagmented chromatin libraries were generated and sequenced on an Illumina NovaSeq with a target sequencing depth of 50 million reads per library.
units.rationale: Tagmentation of bulk nuclei produces a library for genome‑wide chromatin accessibility mapping.

units.title: CUT&Tag library preparation
units.text: CUT&Tag libraries were prepared as previously described60, with modifications. In brief, cells were dissociated from human cortical tissue as described above. Fifty thousand cell aliquots were reconstituted in 200 μl CUT&Tag wash buffer (20 mM HEPES pH 7.5, 150 mM NaCl, 0.5 mM spermidine, 1× protease inhibitor cocktail (Roche)). Nuclei were isolated by resuspending cell pellets in 200 μl dig-wash buffer and washed twice.
units.rationale: CUT&Tag captures protein‑DNA interactions with low input for epigenomic profiling.

units.title: Forebrain organoid seeding and culture initiation
units.text: Cortical organoids were cultured using a forebrain-directed differentia- tion protocol47,58. In brief, two genetically normal human iPS cell lines (H28126 (Gilad Laboratory, University of Chicago) and 1323-4 (Conklin Laboratory, Gladstone Institutes)) were expanded and dissociated into single cells using accutase. Cells were pelleted at 600g in a swinging bucket rotor centrifuge and washed twice and reconstituted in neural induction medium at a density of 10,000 cells per well in 200 μl in 96-well low-adhesion plates.
units.rationale: Seeding single cells at defined density initiates uniform forebrain organoid formation.

units.title: Organoid medium transition at day 35
units.text: At 35 days, organoids were moved into DMEM/F12-based medium con- taining 1× N2, 1× B27 with vitamin A and 1× anti-anti. Throughout the cultu- re duration, organoids were fed every other day.
units.rationale: Switching to vitamin A‑containing medium supports further cortical differentiation.

units.title: pA‑Tn5 tagmentation of nuclei
units.text: pA-Tn5 was added at a dilution of 1:100 in 100 μl dig-med buffer (0.05% digitonin, 20 mM HEPES, pH 7.5, 300 mM NaCl, 0.5 mM spermidine, 1× protease inhibitor) and nuclei were incubated at room temperature for 1 h while rotating.
units.rationale: pA‑Tn5 inserts sequencing adapters into accessible chromatin for ATAC‑seq.

units.title: Library PCR amplification protocol
units.text: Libraries were amplified with the cycling conditions: 72 °C for 5 min; 98 °C for 30 s; 12 cycles of 98 °C for 10 s and 63 °C for 30 s; final exten- sion at 72 °C for 1 min and hold at 4 °C.
units.rationale: PCR enriches adapter‑ligated fragments to generate sufficient material for sequencing.

units.title: Immunohistochemistry staining workflow
units.text: Samples were fixed in 4% PFA for 45 min, washed out with PBS, incubated overnight in a 30% sucrose solution at 4 °C, embedded in a 1:1 solution of OCT and 30% sucrose and frozen at −80 °C until ready for sectioning. Cryosections were prepared at a thickness of 16 μm. Heat-induced antigen retrieval was performed in 10 mM sodium citrate (pH 6.0) for 15 min. Permeabilization was performed in PBS (pH 7.4) supplemented with 2% Triton X-100. Primary and secondary antibodies were diluted and incubated in PBS (pH 7.4) supplemented with 10% donkey serum, 2% Triton X-100, 0.2% gelatin.
units.rationale: The protocol preserves tissue morphology and enables specific antibody labeling for microscopy.
